extendedIngredients.name: new potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound small new potatoes, such as Jersey Royals, Pink Fir Apples, or creamers
metaInformation: such as jersey royals, pink fir apples, or creamers

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: Medium to large pinch of red pepper flakes

extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Several large pinches sea salt, preferably coarse grain or flaked

extendedIngredients.name: tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 to 6 large ripe tomatoes, grated over the large holes of a box grater

extendedIngredients.name: yellow mustard seeds
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons yellow or black mustard seeds

recipes.title: Gingered Tomato-Curry Potatoes
recipes.instructions: 1. Boil the potatoes in their skins until they are just tender; drain and set aside. When cool enough to handle, hold on to each with a clean towel and peel, then break the potatoes up coarsely with a fork, each potato into 3 or so pieces; remove any extra skin that can be picked out and toss the broken potatoes with the turmeric, using a little more than called for in the recipe, if needed, to turn the potatoes a golden yellow. Season to taste with salt.2. In a nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the ginger, garlic, shallots, and mustard seeds. Cook until the mustard seeds start to pop a little, then sprinkle in the cumin seeds, coriander, asafetida, and red pepper flakes.3. Add the tomato and cook mixture over medium heat until it makes a sauce, then gently add the potatoes and toss them in the tomato mixture until well combined.4. Continue to cook down until the tomatoes turn into a thick sauce that clings to the potatoes. Season to taste with salt and sprinkle with ground cumin. Serve warm, or at room temperature, sprinkled with the chopped cilantro.

steps.step: Boil the potatoes in their skins until they are just tender; drain and set aside. When cool enough to handle, hold on to each with a clean towel and peel, then break the potatoes up coarsely with a fork, each potato into 3 or so pieces; remove any extra skin that can be picked out and toss the broken potatoes with the turmeric, using a little more than called for in the recipe, if needed, to turn the potatoes a golden yellow. Season to taste with salt.2. In a nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the ginger, garlic, shallots, and mustard seeds. Cook until the mustard seeds start to pop a little, then sprinkle in the cumin seeds, coriander, asafetida, and red pepper flakes.3.

Add the tomato and cook mixture over medium heat until it makes a sauce, then gently add the potatoes and toss them in the tomato mixture until well combined.4. Continue to cook down until the tomatoes turn into a thick sauce that clings to the potatoes. Season to taste with salt and sprinkle with ground cumin.
Serve warm, or at room temperature, sprinkled with the chopped cilantro.
